questions.question: Translate: Trēs equī pulchrī vōbīs sunt.
options: Three beautiful horses were taken from you.
The three beautiful horses were for you.

questions.question: What rhetorical device is present in the following sentence? Titus plūs vīnī, plūs cibī, plūs pecūniae poposcit.
Who were the nine daughters of Mnemosyne, who brought inspiration to poets and other artists?
What island, home to the ancient Minoans and the legendary palace of King Minos at Knossos, lies to the southeast of mainland Greece?
What emperor, born in Spain, extended the empire through his conquests in Dacia and later was said to have adopted his soon-to-be successor Hadrian only a few days before his death?
During the Roman Republic, what magistrate in the cursus honōrum acted as a judge?

Take each day as it comes
questions.correct_answer: Everyone is entitled to their own opinion.

questions.question: Ā convīviō nōn sine multō cachinnō discessī! What figure of speech can be found in this sentence?

What is the meaning of the Latin phrase nil sub sole novum?
options: There is nothing new under the sun.
Not for ourselves alone are we born.
questions.correct_answer: There is nothing new under the sun.

questions.question: What was the site of the famous oracle of Apollo where the god had killed the giant serpent Python?
